StarCodes.starDesc: Searches the default dial by name directory
No action. Reserved for emergency services in some countries.
Logs in and out of a call queue.
Records a sound clip to be used in a dial plan or call queue (requires prompt recording permissions)
Records a single call (feature must be set up by a system admin). This cannot be used mid-call
Initiates call monitoring (requires monitoring permissions)

Changes personal dialable password (default 0000). This password is used with the dialable username to access permission-based tasks such as recording prompts, making international calls, and call monitoring. It is different from the voicemail password
Records personal directory name to be used in a dial by name directory
Records others’ directory names to be used in a dial by name directory (requires prompt recording permissions)

Places a call on hold in a virtual parking spot on the system. There are an unlimited number of parking spots available. To park in a user-assigned spot, blind transfer to *37 + parking spot number (any number of digits, but it cannot start with 0). To park in a system-assigned spot, warm transfer to *37 (the system will notify you where the call is parked). To answer a parked call, dial *37 + parking spot number.

Initiates hot desking allowing you to load your extension settings to a shared phone and use it as your own. Dial the same star code to log out of a shared phone. This feature is supported on Cisco MPP, Polycom, and Yealink only and must be enabled by a system admin on your user profile and each shared device
Blocks your number from a caller ID for a single call
Activates server-side call forwarding—all incoming calls are forwarded to an internal extension or external number
De-activates server-side call forwarding
Overrides the Block Caller ID setting for a single call
Multicast Paging (Cisco Only) To send a page, dial *96 followed by the zone number. The zone number must always be two digits, so 1 is actually 01.
Picks up a call ringing on another user’s phone (directed call pickup)
Checks other extension, ring group, or shared voicemail boxes
Checks voicemail for the line(s) assigned to the phone
Tests emergency services call notifications
Pages an individual phone, or even an entire ring group, by automatically activating their speakerphone (feature must be enabled on the recipient’s line)
This is for using intercom to page a device or ring group. NOTE: This is not for Multicast Paging
